item.headline: Mission accomplished: All 12 boys and coach rescued from Thai cave
item.summary: Thailand’s navy SEALs confirmed Tuesday that all 12 members of the youth soccer team and one assistant coach have been rescued from a flooded cave, bringing an end to a more than 2 week long ordeal. NBC’s Bill Neely reports.

videos.headline: Focus shifts to Thai soccer team’s health following rescue
videos.summary: Several of the Thai soccer players trapped in a cave complex have been rescued and taken to an isolation unit, where doctors say they’re safe. They have scratches, fever and signs of hypothermia, but so far they are in good health, NBC’s Janis Mackey Frayer reports for TODAY.
videos.label: NEWS

videos.headline: Trump nominates Brett Kavanaugh to Supreme Court
videos.summary: President Trump on Monday evening announced Brett Kavanaugh as his pick to replace retiring Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy. Kavanugh, a solid conservative, spent the last 12 years as a federal appeals court judge in Washington, D.C. The president praised him as a brilliant jurist with “impeccable credentials,” while several Democrats prepare to challenge the pick. NBC’s Peter Alexander reports for TODAY.
videos.label: POLITICS

adobe.videotitle: Trump nominates Brett Kavanaugh to Supreme Court

nielsen.title: Trump nominates Brett Kavanaugh to Supreme Court

comscore.ns_st_ep: Trump nominates Brett Kavanaugh to Supreme Court

videos.headline: What to know about Trump’s Supreme Court pick, Brett Kavanaugh
videos.summary: NBC justice correspondent Pete Williams and NBC’s Kasie Hunt join TODAY to provide background on President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee, federal appeals court Judge Brett Kavanaugh. The conservative justice provides a “solid majority” for the right, Williams said.
videos.label: POLITICS

videos.headline: Government misses court-ordered deadline to reunite youngest migrant children with families
videos.summary: The federal government said it won’t meet Tuesday’s court-ordered deadline to reunite the youngest migrant children, who were separated from their parents after crossing the southern border ilegally. On Monday, a Justice Department lawyer said only two children had been reunited so far, and that 54 of 102 children are expected to be reunited Tuesday. A federal judge has asked the federal government to provide an updated timeline on Tuesday morning, Gabe Gutierrez reports for TODAY from El Paso, Texas.
videos.label: POLITICS

adobe.videotitle: Government misses court-ordered deadline to reunite youngest migrant children with families

videos.headline: George Clooney taken to hospital after scooter crash in Italy
videos.summary: Actor George Clooney was rushed to a local hospital on the Italian island of Sardinia on Tuesday when his scooter collided with a car. Italian officials say Clooney is “not seriously injured,” and the actor has reportedly been discharged, NBC’s Craig Melvin reports for TODAY.

items.headline: Bulls chase daredevils through Pamplona's narrow streets
items.summary: For eight consecutive mornings, runners dodge bulls as they race through Pamplona's old city.
items.label: WORLD

images.headline: San Fermin festival in Pamplona
images.caption:
A reveller is thrown into air during the opening the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, Spain, on July 6, 2018. 
The annual festival, made famous by Ernest Hemingway's 1926 novel "The Sun Also Rises," involves the daily running of the bulls through the historic heart of Pamplona to the bull ring.

images.headline: Fiesta de San Fermin in Pamplona
images.caption: Runners dodge bulls during the second day of the festival on July 8.

images.headline: Day 2 - San Fermin Running of the Bulls 2018
images.caption: Revellers run with fighting bulls on July 7.
Revellers run next to bulls entering the ring on July 10.
Revellers protect themselves as a calf jumps over them in the bullring on July 10.

images.headline: Revellers dodge a "Kiliki" ready to hit with his sponge during San Fermin festival's "Comparsa de gigantes y cabezudos" (Parade of the Giants and Big Heads) in Pamplona
images.caption: Revellers dodge a "Kiliki" ready to hit with his sponge during the festival's "Comparsa de gigantes y cabezudos" (Parade of the Giants and Big Heads) on July 8.

images.headline: Fiesta de San Fermin in Pamplona
images.caption: Runners dodge on July 8.

images.headline: Runners sprint in front of bulls during the fourth running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona
images.caption: Runners sprint in front of bulls on July 1o.

images.headline: Fiesta de San Fermin in Pamplona
images.caption: Bullfighter Octavio Cachon prepares to enter the bullring on July 9.

images.headline: Third bullrun of Sanfermines 2018
images.caption: A bull stumbles on July 9.

images.headline: Third bullrun of Sanfermines 2018
images.caption: epa06874691 Several runners or "mozos" are chased bulls on July 9.

images.headline: Runners pray before the bull run on the fourth day of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona
images.caption: Runners pray before the bull run on July 9.

images.headline: San Fermin festival in Pamplona
images.caption: Spectators wait for the third running of the bulls on July 9.

images.headline: SPAIN-BULLFIGHTING
images.caption:
A participant receives medical attention on July 9.  





 / AFP PHOTO / ANDER GILLENEAANDER GILLENEA/AFP/Getty Images

images.headline: Fiesta de San Fermin in Pamplona
images.caption: Spanish bullfighter Jose Garrido is tossed by a bull July 7.

adobe.news.headline: Bulls chase daredevils through Pamplona's narrow streets

item.headline: Photos: Rescuers save soccer team trapped in Thai cave
item.summary: All 12 boys and their coach have now been freed after a dramatic three-day rescue operation
item.label: WORLD

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption:
Rescue teams gather in a deep cave where a group of boys and their soccer coach went missing in Chang Rai, northern Thailand, on June 25, 2018. 
The group went missing after they set out to explore the cave on June 23.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: Thai soldiers relay an electric cable deep into the Tham Luang cave at the Khun Nam Nang Non Forest Park in Chiang Rai on June 26, 2018 during a rescue operation for a missing children's football team and their coach.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: Thai soldiers carry a hose deep into the Tham Luang cave to pump out water at the Khun Nam Nang Non Forest Park in Chiang Rai on June 27, 2018.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: This handout photo taken by the Royal Thai Navy SEAL shows a team of SEAL divers inspecting the water-filled tunnel in the Tham Luang cave on June 28, 2018.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: Thai soldiers carry equipment inside the flooded cave complex.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: This photo released by Tham Luang Rescue Operation Center, shows the missing boys and their soccer coach as they were found in the dark, partially flooded cave.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: Family members celebrate while camping out near Than Luang cave following news that all members of children's football team and their coach were found alive on July 2, 2018.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: Rescuers are sent inside Tham Luang Nang Non cave to continue rescue efforts on July 03, 2018.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: A video grab made available by the Thai Navy SEALs shows some of the members of a soccer team in a section of Tham Luang cave in Khun Nam Nang Non Forest Park on July 04, 2018.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: A family member prays before a shrine in Tham Luang cave area as rescue operations continue on July 5, 2018.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: Military personnel carry surface supply diving cables out from Tham Luang cave complex on July 5, 2018.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption: Rescue workers work as water is pumped out of Tham Luang cave complex on July 5, 2018.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue
images.caption:
An honor guard holds up a picture of former Thai Navy SEAL diver Samarn Kunan on July 6, 2018.  
Kunan, 38, fell unconscious underwater and died as he attempted to return from placing air tanks deep inside the underground complex.

A letter that was handed to British divers on July 6 in Chiang Rai, Thailand. The letter reads "the kids say don't be worried about them. All of them are strong. They would like to eat many different kinds of foods when they come out and Teachers, please don't give them too much homework".
Thai rescue teams arrange water pumping system at the entrance to a flooded cave complex where 12 boys and their soccer coach have been trapped since June 23, in Mae Sai on July 7.
Nurses wait outside the Chaingrai Prachanukroh Hospital, where the boys will be brought upon rescue, on July 8.
An ambulance carrying one of the boys rescued from Tham Luang Nang Non cave heading towards the hospital on July 8.
Onlookers watch and cheer as ambulances deliver boys rescued from a cave in northern Thailand to hospital in Chiang Rai on July 8.
An image from the Royal Thai Navy Facebook page shows rescuers hands locked with a caption reading "We Thai and the international teams join forces to bring the young Wild Boars home" on July 8.
Classmates of Adul, one of the boys trapped in Tham Luang Nang Non cave, visit a tribute for the Wild Boars soccer team at the entrance of Ban Waingphan school on July 9.

images.headline: Thai rescue
images.caption: Police and military personnel use umbrellas to cover around a stretcher near a helicopter and an ambulance at a military airport in Chiang Rai on July 9, 2018.

images.headline: Thailand Cave Rescue For Trapped Soccer Team
images.caption: Two ambulances carry the sixth and seventh boys out of the cave.
Rescue personnel walk in a cave
Thailand's Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha poses with relatives of boys trapped in a flooded cave.
Rescue personnel prepare the transport for the evacuation of the boys and their soccer coach trapped in a flooded cave.
A group of ambulances go in to Tham Luang cave complex.
An ambulance leaves from the Tham Luang cave area as the operations continue for those still trapped inside.
An emergency team rushes to a helicopter believed to be carrying one of the rescued boys.
A television in a mechanic shop plays the news of the boys rescue from Tham Luang Nang Non cave.
A helicopter believed to be carrying one of the rescued boys from the flooded cave lands in Chiang Rai.
An ambulance transporting members of the children's football team approaches the hospital in the northern Thai city of Chiang Rai.
Onlookers watch and cheer as ambulances transport the 10th rescued schoolboy from a helipad nearby to Chiangrai Prachanukroh Hospital.

adobe.news.headline: Photos: Rescuers save soccer team trapped in Thai cave
adobe.news.author: not available

items.headline: This algorithm can help resettle refugees by giving them a better shot at employment
items.summary: When refugees arrive in a new country, everything is unfamiliar. Most countries just assign refugees to cities completely at random -- or according to where the open spots happen to be when the person arrives. But a new algorithm developed by Stanford’s Immigration Policy Lab could use refugees’ backgrounds to match them with their ideal cities – vastly improving their chance at employment and integration.
items.label: MACH

videos.headline: 'Hard to believe it’s over': The last days of an American dairy farm
videos.summary: Since 1970, more than 90 percent of all U.S. dairy farms have closed due to low milk prices and industry restructuring. Recently, a corporate decision by Walmart led to the shutdown of a three-generation family-run dairy farm in Kentucky. We followed the Coombs family as they're forced to sell off the last of their dairy cows and try to make sense of what's ahead.
videos.label: U.S. NEWS

videos.headline: 'We feel marginalized, we feel discriminated': FEMA ends temporary housing support and evicts displaced Puerto Ricans
videos.summary: Maria Baez-Claudio and her grandson, Christian Dariel fled Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria. They’re part of the estimated 2,000 families still living in hotels with vouchers provided by FEMA but that program is now coming to an end.
videos.label: U.S. NEWS

videos.headline: No parents allowed: Inside New York City's riskiest playground
videos.summary: On Governors Island, just off Manhattan's southern shore, is The Yard — a 50,000 square foot adventure playground where kids are encouraged to take risks and parents aren't allowed inside.

videos.headline: 'At capacity': Asylum seekers face standoff at border between Ciudad Juarez and El Paso
videos.summary: In the past month, Customs and Border Protection agents have been stopping migrants at the beginning of the bridge in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico, rather than at the alternate end in El Paso, Texas. This change has sparked a new debate whether the federal government is trying to deter migrants from entering the U.S.
videos.label: IMMIGRATION

videos.headline: Michigan mom shares account of caring for migrant children separated from parents
videos.summary: Christine, a foster mother in Michigan who has been taking in unaccompanied migrant children since 2016, shares her experiences taking care of children who are being separated from their parents at the border.

videos.headline: After Parkland, some teachers turn to firearm training
videos.summary: Since the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in February, a divisive idea has gained momentum as a way to stem school shootings: arm teachers. At some schools in Ohio, armed teachers have been in classrooms for as many as five years, since the aftermath of the shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary.
videos.label: U.S. NEWS

videos.headline: Escape from abuse: A teenage refugee’s fight for survival
videos.summary: Still a teenager, Fatima fled her life in Afghanistan when her father attempted to marry her off to gain political influence. Now living in Turkey, she shares her story of escape and new life as a refugee.
videos.label: WORLD

items.headline: Inside housing of last resort: One immigrant family's life in 75 square feet
items.summary: Single-room occupancy hotels, or SROs, are the housing of last resort for immigrant families in San Francisco's Chinatown. The fast decline of SROs and the tight supply of other affordable housing are leaving many of these families in limbo.
items.label: ASIAN AMERICA

items.headline: Destructive wildfires race across the U.S. West
items.summary: Firefighters toiled in stifling heat Saturday on the lines of wildfires, making progress against some while struggling to tame others.
items.label: U.S. NEWS

images.caption: Firefighter Jay Wilkens monitors a flaming shed and boat as the Holiday fire burns in Goleta, California, on July 7, 2018.
The sun rises behind a home leveled by the Holiday fire in Goleta, California on Saturday, July 7, 2018. Evacuations were ordered as the fire edged into residential areas.

A charred statuette stands in the remains of a destroyed home in the aftermath of the Holiday Fire on Saturday, July 7, 2018 in Goleta, California. The fire destroyed a number of homes in the community during an intense heat wave which broke various records across Southern California.

Eric Durtschi surveys the remains of his home, leveled by the Holiday fire, in Goleta, California, on Saturday, July 7, 2018. Durtschi, who has six children, said he moved with his family from Utah two weeks ago.
A burnt car sits among the remains of a home that was destroyed by the Holiday Fire in Goleta, California on July 7, 2018.

A firefighter battle flames at the Alpine Oaks Estates mobile home park during a wildfire Friday, July 6, 2018, in Alpine, California. Dozens of fires are burning across the dry American West, fueled by rising temperatures and gusty winds that were expected to last through the weekend.
images.copyright: The San Diego Union-Tribune via AP

images.caption:
Firefighters watch as flames from the County Fire climb a hillside in Guinda, California, on July 1, 2018. 
Californian authorities have issued red flag weather warnings and mandatory evacuation orders after a series of wildfires fanned by high winds and hot temperatures ripped through thousands of acres. The latest blaze, the County Fire sparked in Yolo County on June 30, had by July 1 afternoon spread across 22,000 acres (9,000 hectares) with zero percent containment, according to Cal Fire.
Flames from the County fire burn above Cache Creek Casino Resort on Saturday, June 30, 2018, in Capay, California.
A firefighter scrambles to stop a wildfire as wind drives embers across Highway 20 near Clearlake Oaks, California on Sunday, July 1, 2018.
Celia Corona and her son Marco embrace as they sleep after evacuating from a wildfire in El Jebel, Colorado on Thursday, July 5, 2018, at the Basalt High School, in Basalt, Colorado.
A plane drops fire retardant on the Lake Christine wildfire in Basalt, Colorado on July 4, 2018.

Craig Hotshots firefighters take a break from battling the Weston Pass Fire, Monday, July 2, 2018, near Fairplay, Colorado. In Colorado, more than 2,500 homes were under evacuation orders as firefighters battled more than a half-dozen wildfires.
images.copyright: Summit Daily News via AP v

images.caption: Smoke rises from a wildfire near Strawberry Reservoir in Utah, Thursday, July 5, 2018.
Burned structures caused by a wildfire near Duchesne, Utah, Thursday, July 5, 2018.

adobe.news.headline: Destructive wildfires race across the U.S. West
adobe.news.author: not available

items.headline: Realizing the dream of space: Astronaut Peggy Whitson on leaving Earth for the first time
items.summary: Peggy Whitson made history several times in her career as an astronaut. She spent a record-breaking 665 days in space and became the first woman to command the ISS. In this interview, she describes her historic first spaceflight.
items.label: MAKING OF AN ASTRONAUT
